title: Part a.
stimulusHtml:
2 points

  • One point is earned for stating that the real interest rate in Japan will increase in the short run because the supply of loanable funds will decrease or the demand for loanable funds will increase.

  • One point is earned for stating that private domestic investment in plant and equipment in Japan will decrease.
descriptions:
No points earned.

  • One point is earned for stating that the real interest rate in Japan will increase in the short run because the supply of loanable funds will decrease or the demand for loanable funds will increase.

  • One point is earned for stating that private domestic investment in plant and equipment in Japan will decrease.

Earns 1 of 2 points.

  • One point is earned for stating that the real interest rate in Japan will increase in the short run because the supply of loanable funds will decrease or the demand for loanable funds will increase.

  • One point is earned for stating that private domestic investment in plant and equipment in Japan will decrease.

Earns 2 of 2 points.

  • One point is earned for stating that the real interest rate in Japan will increase in the short run because the supply of loanable funds will decrease or the demand for loanable funds will increase.

  • One point is earned for stating that private domestic investment in plant and equipment in Japan will decrease.

title: Part b.
stimulusHtml:
3 points

  • One point is earned for drawing a correctly labeled graph of the foreign exchange market for the euro.

  • One point is earned for showing that the supply curve for euros shifts to the right and for concluding that the yen price of the euro decreases.

  • One point is earned for explaining that the European purchases of Japanese financial assets will increase due to the relatively higher rate of return in Japan.
descriptions:

title: Part c.
stimulusHtml:
1 point

  • One point is earned for stating that European Central Bank should buy euros.
descriptions:

  • One point is earned for stating that European Central Bank should buy euros.
